page.title: 15Whaddon House
page.content: We went to Whaddon House to visit Mrs WEeatherby. Whaddon House was the rectory until the 1930's. The house stands at the end of Vicarage Road and the building that is there now is the third house. The first house was Elizabethan and there are some walls still standing which were built in Elizabethan times. The house stands on field that was know as Lammas Close. Mr and Mrs Weatherby have a 250 acre farm. They keep Welsh Black Cattle for beef. They have a few horses and the rest of the land is arable - corn and wheat. Most of the farms in this area are arable farms but Coddimore farm and Bottlehouse farm keep sheep as well. Coddimore farm breed horses. Mrs Weatherby thought that they had more pasture land than other farms in the area.
